title: Robotic Force Control Algorithms: Reinforcement Learning and RBF Neural Network Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Control Theory, Basic Neural Networks, and Foundational Robotics Knowledge
context.additional_context: Learners are professionals in medical/legal/technical fields aiming to develop practical skills for applying robotic force control algorithms in industrial settings. Digital tools (laptops, simulation software, etc.) are provided, with formative assessments continuously monitoring progress.

learning_goals: Optimal parameters for robotic force control can be derived using reinforcement learning algorithms.
Environmental stiffness can be predicted and integrated into control systems using RBF neural networks.
Performance improvements of the proposed algorithm compared to PD control and fuzzy control can be analyzed using quantitative metrics.
A control system achieving a force tracking error within Â±0.5N in robot-environment interaction scenarios can be designed.

resources: RBF (Radial Basis Function) neural network implementation library

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
